name: Metcalf Game
description:
This is 'Metcalf Game', a new video game from Outhouse Media.
'Metcalf Game' is set in the cricketing world of 1987 where you play as Ashman, an Ashman who is on the back of an extremely successful cricketing career. A cricketing career with the MCC at Leicestershire is made all the more difficult by the fact that Ashman's family pull their lives into disarray. Exploring a rich and colourful narrative, this will be a classic in the Outhouse catalogue. METCALF GAME was originally produced by The Music Manufacturers Association (MMA) and it consists of four episodes. The first two episodes contain gameplay of this new RTS, followed by a fresh episode about the humble cricket bat. The third – which really means 'game' – is 'The Game', which is a contemporary rocket-jumping game. The climax of this is when you run out of profits and you lose. "Metcalf Game' by Outhouse Media, video game developed by OUTHOUSE GAME The MCC, at the time, were a small amateur cricket league with backing from the CSA and Cricket Australia. Their game included, various types of bats, ramps, balls, bats, and even a game of ball collecting. The MCC were the first cricket team to go on to become part of the professional leagues of Australia. The first episode of 'Metcalf Game' was released on 15 September 1987 and was played to
